# Breaking the Ethers__disambig_1

| recorded   =

Breaking the Ethers is the debut album by the collaborative group Tuatara. Released on Epic Records, it was an attempt by members of Luna, the Screaming Trees and R.E.M. to try their hand at experimental, multi-ethnic music. It was produced by Barrett Martin and Justin Harwood.
Critical reception
}}
Rolling Stone labeled Martin "a post-grunge Mickey Hart." The Los Angeles Times wrote: "Too good for lounge, too organic for techno, R.E.M.'s Peter Buck and his Northwest buddies fashion an instrumental side trip that stands apart from those trendsâ€”and yet contains both hip swing and trippy vibes."
